required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Synovial Fluid Analysis of Intraarticular Elbow Fracture
clinical_study.official_title: Synovial Fluid Analysis of Intraarticular Elbow Fracture

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to obtain and compare bilateral elbow joint synovial fluid from patients with unilateral intraarticular elbow fracture and a contralateral healthy appearing elbow joint. The synovial fluid samples will undergo several forms of analysis for metabolites and proteins. Matched-pair statistical analysis will be performed to determine the metabolites and proteins that may play the greatest role in development of joint contracture.

primary_outcome.time_frame: time of fracture until surgical fixation (up to 5 weeks after injury)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years and older
- Intraarticular elbow fracture (humerus, radial head and/or ulna fracture)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Open elbow fracture
- Bilateral elbow fractures
- Patients with history of osteomyelitis of elbow
- Inflammatory arthropathy (ie. Rheumatoid arthritis)
- Prior surgery on fractured elbow
